reasoning: Severe T-cell immunodeficiency (including SCID and DiGeorge syndrome variants) estimated at ~2-3 per 100k births annually, based on published immunology registries and newborn screening data.
source: Notarangelo LD et al. (2009). Primary Immunodeficiencies: 2009 Update. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 124(6):1161-1178
